pageContext.claim: “Income grew more, last year alone, than over the entire eight years of Obama-Biden.”
pageContext.analysis: Obama of course had to deal with a recession at the start of his administration. Median income started to grow toward the end of his administration, a trend that Trump inherited. In 2019, median incomes did jump sharply. But the pandemic in 2020 should reduce incomes, so Trump will leave office with a mixed record that might even fall short of Obama's. (This is why scoring economic data by presidential term is not especially fruitful.)
